Sapphire_cropped.name: Sapphire
Sapphire_cropped.info: My first ever digital piece that I completed in the middle of a robotics competition at Hueneme Port Regional in 2023. I was still getting used to Procreate and the round brush.

Flowers(1).name: Flowers
Flowers(1).info: My second piece that I didn't spend a lot of time on. It was originally derived from a pencil sketch.

Samurai.name: Samurai
Samurai.info: A random piece that I wanted to complete. Looked better in my head than on the tablet. Here's one of the first times I tried to draw gold, or any metal, ever.

Angel_cropped.name: Angel
Angel_cropped.info: One of the first pieces I tried back-lighting on, but my main focus while drawing this was the background, not the character. I really liked the scenery, but I didn't know how to draw clothing at the time.

Dragon_cropped(1).name: Dragon
Dragon_cropped(1).info: This was actually one of my most hated artworks. This was the tipping point for me to start actually studying digital. I had gathered up a bunch of artists that I enjoyed, so I studied them for a while.

Sailor_cropped.name: Sailor
Sailor_cropped.info: This was the first artwork after my studies. I can say, it looks much different, and better, than the previous piece. First time I finally realized core shadow was important. I also switched over to a blockier look.

Machine_cropped.name: Machine
Machine_cropped.info: I always wanted to do something mechanical instead of fantastical. Here was my attempt at that. I still didn't know how to draw metal, so nothing looks shiny â€“ just plain rough steel. But the lighting was nice.

Dragon_cropped(2).name: Dragon
Dragon_cropped(2).info: This piece took way too long to complete, with me working on it daily. This was where I encountered the problem of layers. I was using so many to the point I had to duplicate the piece, and collapse some layers in one of the copies to prevent permanently deleting layers. This was also when I actually studied how to draw metal.

Reaper.name: Reaper
Reaper.info: Sadly, this was one of the pieces I hated the most as well. It looked much better in my head than on the tablet. I'm not sure why.

Puppet.name: Puppet
Puppet.info: I enjoyed making this piece. There are quite a few things I would've changed, but overall I enjoyed how it turned out. It was a more abstract piece with less actual rendering and more stylistic coloring, using shades that don't typically appear.

Jelly.name: Jelly
Jelly.info: This is one of my favorite pieces, despite being made a while ago. I enjoyed the color palette, and the semi-transparent jellyfish was nearly perfect. The backlight was also very nice. The only issue I had was with the clothing and pose.

Conductor.name: Conductor
Conductor.info: I drew this after a trip to Japan (hence the JR logo). I saw that some train stations had mascots and wanted to create my own. I sketched the original idea for this while riding the train actually.

Demon(1).name: Demon
Demon(1).info: Created this after looking at a bunch of AI pieces. I really wanted to create something similar, so I tried. It turned out alright in my book, but could've been much better. The lighting is all over the place...

Angel.name: Angel
Angel.info: The second angel piece I have here! Was pretty detailed, but the metal was shabby in my opinion. After this, I decided I wanted to adopt a more paint-like style, instead of this smoothened out style.

Flowers(2).name: Flowers
Flowers(2).info: My first time experimenting with a new brush I made, that forces me to use blocky shapes. I really really enjoyed the block style, so I kept it. This piece was inspired by AI.

Miku.name: Miku
Miku.info: Drew this for a friend, though I never showed them. They were obsessed with Miku, and I wanted to practice some more. My first ever drawing of any existing character instead of something I made up.

Pirate.name: Pirate
Pirate.info: This was originally created as a redraw of the Sailor piece. I'd like to think it turned out better. It's colors are more extreme, but again, I seemed to have forgotten how to draw metal again.

Demon(2).name: Demon
Demon(2).info: This was drawn after a long long break (2 months) where I was extremely busy. I think it turned out surprisingly well given I basically drew nothing digitally during this time period. The metal armor turned out nice.

2024.info: A very rushed piece as I was running out of time. Drew this on the Carnival cruise ship to Mexico during winter break. Personally, I think it turned out suboptimal, but it is a piece nonetheless.

Discord.name: Discord
Discord.info: A random piece that I did for some friends on Discord. Overall, unremarkable, but I really liked the metal rendering on the knee and hands.

Justice.name: Justice
Justice.info: Another hated piece. It looked much better in my head, but on the tablet it looks terrible, personally. This was my last piece before another long break as I got busy again.

Dragon_Tamer.name: Dragon Tamer
Dragon_Tamer.info: Finally drew something after another 2 month break. It turned out decently, and the style of person suddenly changed to more realistic after the break. Dragon's body is based off of Toothless!

Smoke.name: Smoke
Smoke.info: Went through multiple drafts, and this was the one I settled on. I could not figure out a good lighting scheme and background, and it turned out alright. The fire was fun to draw, though.

Be_Your_Army.name: Be Your Army
Be_Your_Army.info: Started out as a cool sketch that I turned digital. The helmet turned out nice, but the face and body was rushed. The overall theme and background was cool though. It took me a while to get that oil-spill effect.

Blob_King.name: Blob King
Blob_King.info: My profile picture! I had a few cool reference photos for this piece and the semi-transparent jelly feel turned out really nice. The foreground and background were rushed though.

Airship_Lore.name: Airship Lore
Airship_Lore.info: Wanted to try a more landscape-ish drawing after another break. So, I created this. Lighting and clothing wise, turned out really nice, but I forgot the reflection in the glass. First time drawing clouds and sky.

Death_And_Fate.name: Death and Fate
Death_And_Fate.info: Saw a cool drawing online. Did a study of it. I forgot the artist's name. Tried to use more saturated colors and complementary color pairs to emphasize light and dark. Turned out alright.

Halloween.name: Halloween (2024)
Halloween.info: Wanted to expand more on the line art and sketch focus of the previous piece. So, this piece is much more sketching and dirty. The shapes didn't turn out as clearly as I had hoped. The metal, ghost, and candles turned out nicely though.
